image.altText: A side view of Roger Cook speaking at a press conference

items.synopsis: Just five weeks after being legislated, Roger Cook announces the WA government will be scrapping its Aboriginal Cultural Heritage Laws which he says caused 'division' and 'confusion' in the community.

title.children: WA to repeal controversial Indigenous cultural heritage laws weeks after they started

image.altText: Flowers in front of a Baptist church.

items.synopsis: As the community of Korumburra in Victoria's east waits for answers on the three deaths believed to be caused by a poisonous mushroom meal, parishioners at the local Baptist church say they "don't pass any judgement" about the circumstances of the tragedy.

title.children: 'We don't pass any judgement': Korumburra churchgoers pray for those involved in suspected mushroom triple fatality

image.altText: A Transport Safety Bureau investigator places recovered MRH-90 Taipan voice and flight data recorder for transport in white box

items.synopsis: The MRH90 Taipan ditched into the ocean south of Hamilton Island 10 days ago during a training exercise.

title.children: Army helicopter's black box found as search for bodies of crew continues in Whitsundays

image.altText: Colombia's Linda Caceido dribbles the ball against a Jamaican defender, while a teammate looks on from behind.

items.synopsis: We will find out tonight whether the Matildas will face France or Morocco in the FIFA Women's World Cup quarterfinals, but first, surprise packets Colombia and Jamaica face off in Melbourne. Follow live.

title.children: Tonight we find out the Matildas' next opponent, but first it's Colombia vs Jamaica

liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Colombia vs Jamaica is underway in Melbourne

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a black suit and purple tie.

items.synopsis: A convicted killer is labelled a "liar" by his victim's family, with a court hearing he committed murder in 2007 and went to great lengths to cover up the crime.

title.children: 'I hope he dies in prison': Victim's family hits out at convicted murderer

image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

items.synopsis: The ACT Bar Association said outgoing Director of Public Prosecutions Shane Drumgold currently held a restricted government practising certificate that allowed him to work as a barrister in the ACT, but only while employed in the top job or for that office.

title.children: ACT Bar Association has 'grave concerns' over findings of 'serious misconduct' against outgoing top prosecutor

image.altText: Hands put Australian coins into a wallet.

items.synopsis: Consumer confidence was down across all the mainland states, as analysis points to consumers still bracing for further rate rises.

title.children: Survey points to RBA cash rate over 5 per cent, as household sentiment plunges

image.altText: two men close up

items.synopsis: One Nation's NSW leader Mark Latham files his defence to a defamation action brought by independent MP Alex Greenwich.

title.children: Latham claims alleged homophobic tweets 'enhanced' Greenwich's reputation

image.altText: A North Melbourne VFL player holds up his left hand during a match against the Sydney Swans.

items.synopsis: North Melbourne midfielder Ben Cunnington joins a growing group of star retirements in the AFL. Check out the full list here.

title.children: 'My perspective in life was too great': Inspirational Kangaroos veteran calls time on AFL career

image.altText: A koala sitting on the sand on a beach.

items.synopsis: Customers at a beach cafe in northern NSW were surprised to see a koala strolling along the sand in the winter sun. But its adventure has sparked concerns about habitat loss.

title.children: Rare sight of koala visiting beach delights onlookers, but wildlife carers raise concerns

image.altText: A composite image of Christopher Pyne and Joe Hockey

items.synopsis: In Australia there has long been disquiet about the revolving door between high political office and big business. Look at the defence industry, for example, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: A new generation of former MPs has turned to big business

image.altText: Flowers and police tape in scene of crime

items.synopsis: Tiffany Woodley is the victim of what police believe was a domestic dispute. WARNING: Indigenous readers are advised this story contains photos of someone who has died.

title.children: Mother killed in 'horrific' alleged domestic violence case identified, as homicide detectives investigate

items.synopsis: In the 1967 referendum on Indigenous rights, the NSW electorate of Cowper recorded one of the highest "no" votes. Now, Gumbaynggirr elders are reflecting on past lessons as they prepare for the second Indigenous referendum in their lifetime.

title.children: 'Thorn in everybody's side': Elders share thoughts on the Voice vote

image.altText: A view of a car damaged during heavy rain and strong winds brought by Typhoon Khanun in Chatan

items.synopsis: Today's latest news, as it happened.

title.children: Flights cancelled as Typhoon Khanun lingers and K-pop star begins military service. Catch up with The Loop

image.altText: A group of soccer players wearing yellow and green hug each other while celebrating a win

items.synopsis: Having grappled with their heavyweight status, the Matildas defeated Denmark in the way only a serious World Cup contender should.

title.children: Are the Matildas coming of age after mature World Cup win over Denmark?

image.altText: An Australian women's basketballer stands talking at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Ex-Opal Liz Cambage makes the shock claim she is trying to play for Nigeria, the basketball team she was accused of racially abusing before the Tokyo Olympics.

title.children: 'I would love to start fresh': Controversial ex-Opal Liz Cambage tips shock switch to Nigeria

items.synopsis: A man who has type 1 diabetes is calling for more awareness after being questioned about his insulin and jelly beans while trying to enter a nightclub in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Man claims he was questioned at nightclub for carrying insulin for his type 1 diabetes

image.altText: A woman in a red hat leaning on a rusty bar of a gate.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Gina Rinehart claim a 1987 agreement shows Wright Prospecting relinquished any rights to Hancock Prospecting's Hope Downs project.

title.children: Court hears of 'fatal clauses' in Wright Prospecting's claim on Gina Rinehart's iron ore riches

image.altText: Person sleeping face down.

items.synopsis: Non-Indigenous Australians are 18 per cent more likely to die due to extreme heat compared to Indigenous Australians, a study has found. The remedy is common sense, according to a Warumungu elder.

title.children: Why too much air-conditioning is making it harder to cope with extreme heat

image.altText: A burnt out house with tape around it.

items.synopsis: The body of a 60-year-old woman was found in the burnt-out house at Goldie, near Lancefield.

title.children: Man accused of murder appears in court after fatal house fire north of Melbourne

image.altText: A close-up photo of two mushrooms being held by a research wearing blue rubber gloves.

items.synopsis: As a small town in Victoria's east mourns the loss of three well-known community members who are believed to have eaten poisonous mushrooms, health officials are warning people to avoid foraging for fungi.

title.children: The death cap mushroom is one of the deadliest in Victoria. Here's what we know about it

image.altText: A streak of light in the sky at night.

items.synopsis: Australia's space agency says an object that looked like a flaming meteor in the night sky over Victoria and Tasmania last night was most likely remnants of a Russian rocket returning to earth.

title.children: Flaming 'meteor' seen over south-eastern Australia likely Russian rocket parts, authorities say

image.altText: man walking away from camera in snow

items.synopsis: Trail runners and police urge people to "be prepared for the unexpected" after a runner was lost for several hours in the Victorian Alps.

title.children: Wrong turn in the snow, 25km off course, but chance encounter saves runner's life

image.altText: A portrait of a smiling man with dark hair and dark eyes.

items.synopsis: Christopher Jarvis has not been seen since 2006, when his burnt-out vehicle was found in bushland in the state's south-west.

title.children: Victorian prosecutors drop charge against cold case murder accused

image.altText: An aerial view of Melbourne's south-eastern suburbs.

items.synopsis: Only seven of Victoria's 79 councils have confirmed they've waived any rates in the current financial year, despite many residents reporting financial hardship.

title.children: Only a handful of Victorian local councils waiving rates for residents doing it tough, investigation finds

image.altText: A tall teenager holds a basketball and stares at the camera

items.synopsis: Ricky Cunningham wants to play basketball professionally but his council has just removed the local basketball hoops, leaving a group of youths with nowhere to practise.

title.children: Kids in this neighbourhood were meeting up to shoot hoops. Then the noise complaints started

image.altText: The ASX close to steady in early trade as seen on the exchange's board at its Sydney office

items.synopsis: The Australian share market ran out of steam as falling exports and imports in China weighed on investors.  James Hardie jumped after it saw first quarter profit rise.

title.children: ASX treads water despite Wall Street gains, China trade flop, and weak consumer confidence weighs on investors — as it happened

image.altText: Luke Shuey celebrates with arms outstretched after kicking teh winning goal.

items.synopsis: The 2018 premiership player makes the announcement less than a week after teammate Shannon Hurn called time on his career.

title.children: Retiring West Coast Eagles great Luke Shuey reveals he was 'hoping for tap on the shoulder'

image.altText: A woman in a sari stands in front of shelves lined with black pots

items.synopsis: Gautam Adani won the tender to transform one of the world's largest slums into a thriving, modern metropolis. But those in Dharavi fear the development could push them out and turn it into a playground for the rich.

title.children: India's rich and famous live on the edge of a Mumbai slum. Now the land has become highly coveted

image.altText: Photo of chillis

items.synopsis: Chilli might turn up the heat on the food you eat but turn down the risk of dementia, researchers at one Queensland university say.

title.children: Spicy chilli to be probed for dementia-preventing capabilities

image.altText: Zoom call teleconference meeting with cup of coffee.

items.synopsis: During the height of the pandemic, Zoom became so popular that its use sparked phrases like "zoom fatigue". But as employers navigate a post-COVID world, the company is ordering staff back to the office.

title.children: Zoom and WFH became synonymous during COVID. Now the company is ordering staff back to the office

image.altText: A woman hold glass bottles and sorts recycling into different tubs on a kitchen bench.

items.synopsis: In a phenomenon known as the 'eco gender gap', women are more committed to regular recycling than men; try to waste less food; and they try to use less water, and they're more likely to regularly turn off the heating when they're not home.

title.children: Women drive many sustainable living practices. Here's how to even up the 'eco gender gap'

image.altText: A young woman with a medical face mask under her chin sits in a chair and looks at the camera with a half-smile.

items.synopsis: The supermodel says she has been through more than 100 days of "Lyme, chronic disease, co-infection treatment". Get up to speed on Lyme disease and how it's different in Australia.

title.children: Bella Hadid says this condition contributed to her 'invisible suffering', but what is Lyme disease?

image.altText: Martin, Selena and Steve look at something beyond the camera with a shocked expression as they stand on a stage.

items.synopsis: With the most Oscar nominations in history, Meryl Streep hardly needs an introduction. But if you're yet to watch Only Murders in the Building, here's everything you need to know ahead of season three.

title.children: Meryl Streep has joined Only Murders in the Building. Here's your guide to the 'cosy crime' series

image.altText: America Ferrera in a white dress standing in front of a pink Barbie convertible with Barbie written behind her

items.synopsis: America Ferrera has gone viral in recent weeks for her feminist monologue in Barbie, which is a turning point in the film.

title.children: Loved America Ferrera's Barbie monologue? She's been building up to it her whole career
